content: Karthik Pattabiraman | Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of British Columbia Karthik Pattabiraman Electrical and Computer Engineering, University of British Columbia Skip to content HomePapers Selected Papers (after 2010) All Papers (after 2010) Old Papers (before 2010) Students Graduated Students Group Photos Prospective Students Courses EECE 309, 2012 term 1 EECE 310, Winter Term 2, 2011 EECE 310: Software Engineering (W2009, T2) EECE 310: Software Engineering (W2010, T1) EECE 417: Software Architecture EECE 496: Projects EECE 513: Design of Fault-tolerant Systems EECE 513: Fault-tolerant Digital Systems Software Activities Press Bio About Me I am Karthik Pattabiraman, a Professor of Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE) at the University of British Columbia (UBC) in Vancouver, Canada (since 2010). I received my PhD in 2009 in Computer Science from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (UIUC), where I worked with Ravi Iyer and Zbigniew Kalbarczyk in the DEPEND research group in CSL. I received an MS in Computer Science also from UIUC in 2004, working with Dan Reed, and my B.Tech from Sri Venkateswara College of Engineering, University of Madras, India, in 2001. Before joining UBC, I was a post-doctoral researcher at Microsoft Research (Redmond) working with Ben Zorn in the Research in Software Engineering (RiSE) group in 2009. Detailed bio New: Honored to be elected vice-chair of the IEEE Technical Committee on Dependable Computing and Fault-Tolerance (TCFT) from 2025-27. Thanks, everyone, for your support. Looking forward to serving the community.
